item.description: % Bootstrapping a Secure Infrastructure % Oliver Mussell % 2016-2017 Overview Design Implementation Detailed Design IPv6 IPv6 is the latest version of the IP protocol, which offers significant advantages over IPv4. IPv6 uses a 128-bit address which allows a much larger address space, 2^128. A single /64 subnet has a size of 2^64 addresses which equates to the square of the entire IPv4 address space. An address is represented as eight groups of four hexadecimal digits with the groups separated by colons, e.
